Class EventService

java.lang.Object
org.example.service.AbstractService<Long,Event>
org.example.service.EventService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Service<Long,Event>
public class EventService extends AbstractService<Long,Event>

  • Constructor Details

    • EventService

      public EventService(Repository<Long,Event> eventRepository, Repository<Long,User> userRepository, ValidatorContext<Event> validatorEvent)
      Creates an AbstractService with the given Repository
      Parameters:
      eventRepository - the repository used by the service

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(String... fields)
      Adds a new event based on the provided details and validates its data. If the event already exists, it throws an EventAlreadyExists exception.
      Parameters:
      fields - a variable number of strings representing the event data: the first parameter is the event type (e.g., "RaceEvent"), and the second parameter is the event name.
      Throws:
      EventAlreadyExists - if an event with the given name already exists.

    • remove

      public void remove(String id)
      Removes the event with the specified identifier. If the identifier is not valid or if the event is not found, appropriate exceptions are thrown.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the event to be removed
      Throws:
      IdValidationException - if the specified id cannot be parsed as long
      EntityNotFoundException - if no event with the specified id exists

    • generateID

      public Long generateID()
      Generates a new unique identifier for an Event. The method iterates through all existing events and identifies the highest existing ID, incrementing it by 1 to generate a new, unique identifier.
      Returns:
      the newly generated unique identifier as Long

    • exists

      public boolean exists(String flockName)
      Checks if an event with the specified name exists in the repository.
      Parameters:
      flockName - the name of the event to search for
      Returns:
      true if an event with the given name exists, false otherwise

    • addSpectatorToEvent

      public void addSpectatorToEvent(String eventId, String userId)
      Adds a spectator to the specified event. This method validates the event ID and user ID, ensuring they are numeric and exist in their respective repositories. If the user is already a spectator of the event, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the identifier of the event to which the user will be added as a spectator
      userId - the identifier of the user to be added as a spectator to the event
      Throws:
      IdValidationException - if the eventId or userId cannot be parsed as long
      EntityNotFoundException - if no event or user with the specified id exists
      IllegalArgumentException - if the user is already a spectator of the event

    • removeSpectatorFromEvent

      public void removeSpectatorFromEvent(String eventId, String userId)
      Removes a spectator from a specified event. This method validates the event ID and user ID, ensuring they are numeric and exist in their respective repositories. If the user is not a spectator of the event, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the identifier of the event from which the spectator will be removed
      userId - the identifier of the user to be removed as a spectator from the event
      Throws:
      IdValidationException - if the eventId or userId cannot be parsed as long
      EntityNotFoundException - if no event or user with the specified id exists
      IllegalArgumentException - if the user is not a spectator of the event

    • addParticipantsToEvent

      public void addParticipantsToEvent(String eventId, String userId)
      Adds a participant to a specific RaceEvent. This method validates the event ID and user ID, ensuring they are numeric and exist in their respective repositories. It checks that the event is a RaceEvent, the user is a Duck, and the Duck is a Swimmer. It also ensures the Duck is not already a participant in the RaceEvent or a spectator in the event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the identifier of the event to which the participant will be added
      userId - the identifier of the user to be added as a participant
      Throws:
      IdValidationException - if the eventId or userId cannot be parsed as long
      EntityNotFoundException - if no event or user with the specified id exists, or if the user is not a Duck
      IllegalArgumentException - if the event is not a RaceEvent, if the Duck is not a Swimmer, if the user is already a spectator, or if the user is already a participant

    • removeParticipantsFromEvent

      public void removeParticipantsFromEvent(String eventId, String duckId)
      Removes a participant from a specific RaceEvent. This method ensures that the event ID and duck ID are valid and checks that the event is a RaceEvent, the user is a Duck, and the Duck is a Swimmer. It verifies that the Duck is a participant of the RaceEvent before removal.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the identifier of the event from which the participant will be removed
      duckId - the identifier of the duck to be removed as a participant from the event
      Throws:
      IdValidationException - if the eventId or duckId cannot be parsed as long
      EntityNotFoundException - if no event or user with the specified ID exists, or if the user is not a Duck
      IllegalArgumentException - if the event is not a RaceEvent, if the Duck is not a Swimmer, or if the Duck is not a participant of the RaceEvent

    • addLaneToRaceEvent

      public void addLaneToRaceEvent(String eventId, String laneValue)
      Adds a lane to a specified RaceEvent. This method validates the event ID and the lane value, ensuring they are numeric and valid. It ensures the event exists, is of type RaceEvent, and that the new lane distance is greater than the distance of the last existing lane. If validations fail, corresponding exceptions are thrown.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the identifier of the RaceEvent to which the lane will be added
      laneValue - the value of the lane to be added, in numeric format
      Throws:
      IdValidationException - if the eventId cannot be parsed as long
      EntityNotFoundException - if no event with the specified ID exists
      IllegalArgumentException - if the event is not a RaceEvent, or if the laneValue is invalid or less than or equal to the last existing lane distance

    • removeLaneFromRaceEvent

      public void removeLaneFromRaceEvent(String eventId, String indexValue)
      Removes a lane from a specific race event identified by its event ID and lane index.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the unique identifier of the race event. Must be a numeric string.
      indexValue - the 1-based index of the lane to be removed from the race event. Must be a numeric string.
      Throws:
      IdValidationException - if the provided event ID is not a valid number.
      EntityNotFoundException - if no event is found with the provided ID.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the event is not a RaceEvent, if the index value is not a valid number, or if there are no lanes to remove.
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified lane index is out of the valid range.

    • getLanes

      public List<Double> getLanes(String eventId)
      Retrieves the lane data for a given race event based on the event ID.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the unique identifier of the event, provided as a String
      Returns:
      a list of lane numbers represented as Double values
      Throws:
      IdValidationException - if the provided event ID is not a valid number
      EntityNotFoundException - if no event is found with the provided ID
      IllegalArgumentException - if the event associated with the ID is not a RaceEvent

    • start

      public List<DuckResult> start(String eventId)
      Starts the specified event by its ID. If the event is a race event, it verifies that the number of lanes is enough for the participants and that there are lanes available. If the conditions are met, it notifies subscribers and determines the best ducks for the given race lanes.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the identifier of the event to start. It must be a string representing a valid number.
      Returns:
      a list of DuckResult objects representing the results of the best participating ducks in the race event.
      Throws:
      IdValidationException - if the provided eventId is not a valid numeric value.
      NotEnoughParticipantsException - if the race event does not have enough participants compared to the number of lanes.
      NotEnoughLanesException - if the race event does not have enough lanes to start.
      EntityNotFoundException - if the event with the specified ID is not found.

    • findById

      public Event findById(String id)
      Finds and returns the Event object associated with the given ID. Converts the provided string ID to a long value and retrieves the corresponding Event. If the conversion fails, an IdValidationException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      id - the string representation of the Event's ID
      Returns:
      the Event associated with the given ID
      Throws:
      IdValidationException - if the given ID is not a valid numeric string

    • removeUserFromAllEvents

      public void removeUserFromAllEvents(String userId)
      Removes a user from all events in the repository. The user is removed as a participant from any RaceEvent they are part of, or as a subscriber from general events. If the user is successfully removed from at least one event, the repository is saved.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to be removed from all events. The ID must be a numeric string; otherwise, an IdValidationException is thrown.
      Throws:
      IdValidationException - if the provided userId is not a valid numeric string.
